result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Westom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Westom

records.addlTxt:
04:00 PM .  Defendant Michael J. Westom in court w/o counsel.    Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Here on OTSC .  Defendant paid the remaining balance of his restitution today.  State moves to withdraw OTSC. No further items remain on DAGP.
Defendant found guilty of an amended change of misdemeanor theft -943.20(1)(a).  DAGP allowed to terminate early.
Sentence:
Court Costs ( already paid )+ $55.00 SBDA

It is hereby Ordered that the defendant appear on 10/03/19 at 4 PM and show cause why he/she should not be found guilty and sentenced for failure to comply with the Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement.
Proposed Order to Show Cause
State's Petition to Show Cause

Case called at 2:35 pm.  Defendant Michael J. Westom in court without counsel.  Meri C. Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State withdraws it's motion to revoke the DAGP. The DAGP coordinator is willing to continue the DAGP as long as the defendant continues to make  payments.  The defendant indicates he will be able to continue making payments.  Court approves withdrawal of Motion to Revoke.
DPAH:  5/4/20 at 9:30 am.
Order to show cause hearing on June 18, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Order to show cause hearing on June 15, 2018 at 09:00 am.

(Case called at 9:07 AM)
Defendant Michael J. Westom in court without counsel.  Meri C. Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant wishes to proceed today without an attorney.  State gives background of case- Defendant placed on DAGP on May 4, 2017; State indicates the defendant has done nothing other than make a couple of payments toward restitution which is the reason for the State filing an Order to Show Cause.  Court suggests matter be set out for the Defendant to meet with DAGP Coordinator (Steve Judd).  Defendant to make appointment today to meet with Steve Judd.
Order to Show Cause Hearing: June 15, 2018 at 9:00 AM
Order to show cause hearing on May 21, 2018 at 09:00 am.

(Case called at 3:13 PM)
Defendant Michael J. Westom in court.  Meri C. Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State filed Petition and Order to Show Cause to revoke DAGP.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney and is directed to the Public Defender Office.  Matter adjourned for defendant to obtain an attorney.
Order to Show Cause Hearing: May 21, 2018 at 9:00 AM
